abstract: A hacker organization known as Anonymous has released e-mail messages provided by a former Bank of America employee who claims they show how a division of the bank sought to hide information on foreclosures.
snippet: A hacker organization known as Anonymous has released e-mail messages provided by a former Bank of America employee who claims they show how a division of the bank sought to hide information on foreclosures.
lead_paragraph: A hacker organization known as Anonymous released a series of e-mails on Monday provided by a former Bank of America employee who claims they show how a division of the bank sought to hide information on foreclosures.

headline.main: Bank of America Unit Tried to Hide Foreclosure Information, Hackers Say

abstract: A former client and shareholder of Iceland’s Kaupthing Bank claims that the bank used deposits to artificially inflate its share price for a year before the bank collapsed in 2008.
snippet: A former client and shareholder of Iceland’s Kaupthing Bank claims that the bank used deposits to artificially inflate its share price for a year before the bank collapsed in 2008.

headline.main: Ex-Client Says Kaupthing Inflated Its Shares

abstract: Rocky Balboa | Kegger at the Dot-Com!| More Buffett | How Twitter Started
snippet: Rocky Balboa | Kegger at the Dot-Com!| More Buffett | How Twitter Started
lead_paragraph: Hacker Slacker FT Alphaville, under the headline of the day, “Rocky Balboa,” is disappointed with the e-mails of the Bank of America unit that were released: “Unless we’ve missed something, the documents released last night added little to our understanding of a complicated and sad story that continues to blight ordinary Americans and the U.S. economy.” FT Alphaville
